p: Foot swelling, which is a measure of acute arthritis and peaks on day 6/7 in this model [ 27, 32, 36], was substantially and significantly reduced in mice kept at 30°C ( Fig 1C, arrow). H&E staining of foot sections during acute arthritis illustrated the previously described [ 32] prodigious mononuclear inflammatory infiltrate in feet of CHIKV-infected mice housed at 22°C ( Fig 1D, 22°C). In contrast, mice housed at 30°C showed substantially lower numbers of infiltrating cells ( Fig 1D, 30°C). Quantification of the histology (by Aperio pixel count [ 27]) confirmed this difference was highly significant ( Fig 1E). In addition, immunohistochemistry [ 44] showed less CHIKV antigen in foot tissues of mice kept at 30°C ( Fig 1F; mock samples are shown in S1B Fig); with quantification demonstrating significance ( Fig 1G).
